title: veclibfort fix on osx 10.11
body:
I apparently need veclibfort on my osx system for mfem+petsc+sundials+hypre+lapack.

It doesn't build out of the box on my osx 10.11 system. But, I think my os version is 1 patch behind what is typical at this point. I have an easy fix but I dunno if it would hurt others.

Next, I didn't honestly find veclibfort package.py file to be too complete. For example it calls make specifying a value for PREFIX= but the Makefile for that package sets PREFIX by fiat in first line of the Makefile ignoring whatever Spack passed in via PREFIX= on the command line to Make. So, I honestly don't think that package has ever been installed correctly by spack. It winds up installing to /usr/local/lib. Next, it uses 'clang' compiler by default. Now, it may be that Spack's compiler magic winds up `catching` that and still doing the right thing anyways. Finally, with gcc-6.1 on my osx system, I needed to add CFLAGS=-flax-vector-conversions to get it compile and run correctly.

Does anyone see any problems with a pull request with these changes?
